title: Pokémon Go Fest 2025 event habitat spawns and bonuses
description: Pokémon Go‘s big yearly event is upon us. Pokémon Go Fest 2025 comes with its usual perks, including rotating spawns and the global debut of the Crowned forms of Zacian and Zamazenta. The Crowned forms are the main feature here, encouraging all players to hop into raids to score energy to turn their Hero of […]
author: Julia Lee
excerpt: Here’s a quick rundown of what you need to know about Go Fest 2025
text: Pokémon Go’s big yearly event is upon us. Pokémon Go Fest 2025 comes with its usual perks, including rotating spawns and the global debut of the Crowned forms of Zacian and Zamazenta.The Crowned forms are the main feature here, encouraging all players to hop into raids to score energy to turn their Hero of Many Battles form puppies into big dogs. This event also features the global debut for Volcanion, but only if you have the paid ticket for the event. As usual with these events, there’s a ton of perks (including increased shiny rate for wild spawns) locked up behind the $15 ticket, but free players can still take advantage of fun spawns and Crowned Zacian and Zamazenta.Below we dive into the perks and rotating spawns for Pokémon Go Fest: Global 2025.Table of ContentsWhat time does Pokémon Go Fest start and end?Pokémon Go Fest 2025 habitat spawn schedulePokémon Go Fest 2025: Global ticket bonusesPokémon Go Fest 2025 event Field ResearchPokémon Go Fest 2025 event special movesPokémon Go Fest 2025 event egg hatchesPokémon Go Fest 2025 event raid targetsWhat time does Pokémon Go Fest start and end?Pokémon Go Fest 2025 will run on June 28 and 29, starting at 10 a.m. and ending at 6 p.m. in your local time. There are a few ticket-holder bonuses that also last outside of that time window, like the halved Stardust cost for trading, but the bulk of the good stuff will only be available from 10 a.m. until 6 p.m.Though you are highly encouraged to play throughout the day to make the most of your ticket purchase, and ensure you have plenty of time to complete each habitat’s Collection Challenges, even if you only log in once each day, you will unlock the Special Research to complete at your leisure.Note that Zamazenta will be in raids on Saturday, June 28 and Zacian will be in raids on Sunday, June 29, so if you want both dogs, you’ll need to raid on both days.Pokémon Go Fest 2025 habitat spawn scheduleImage: NianticThese habitats will rotate all throughout the event (which is a change from last year, where they only rotated on Saturday), even if you don’t have a ticket. Each habitat will rotate in twice per day and be around for an hour before it rotates out.This time, each day also has additional spawns that will be around in addition to the rotating habitats.It should also be noted that the costume-wearing Pikachu and Falinks (as seen in the above image) are not listed as an available spawn on the Pokémon Go website. They are available through other means. Falinks appears to be a raid and Field Research exclusive and Pikachu can be obtained via raids, Field Research, and photobombs.Moonless Volcano (10-11 a.m., 2-3 p.m.)HoundourNumelDuskullGothitaGolettFletchlingFlabébé (red)SkrelpFuecocoCarbinkTorkoal (ticket-holder Incense only)All of the above Pokémon can be found shiny.Galvanic Dojo (11 a.m.-12 p.m, 3-4 p.m.)MachopElectabuzzTeddirusaScraggyChespinFlabébé (yellow)PanchamDedenneCrabrawlerMienfooSkiddo (ticket-holder Incense only)All of the above Pokémon can be found shiny.Hypnotic Tundra (12-1 p.m., 4-5 p.m.)Alolan SandshrewSwinubSphealPiplupSnoverMunnaElgyemFlabébé (blue)BergmiteFrigibaxPachirisu (ticket-holder Incense only)All of the above Pokémon can be found shiny.Fae Swamp (1-2 p.m., 5-6 p.m.)ClefairyTentacoolMawileGulpinVenipedePopplioMareanieMorelullTogeticFlabébé (orange)Klefki (ticket-holder Incense only)All of the above Pokémon can be found shiny, except Klefki.Saturday all-day spawnsChanseySkarmoryLarvitarShieldonShelmetVullabyOranguruGoomyAll of the above Pokémon can be found shiny.Sunday all-day spawnsGalarian Farfetch’dCuboneRaltsKarrablastPawniardDeinoPassimianJangmo-oAll of the above Pokémon can be found shiny.Pokémon Go Fest 2025: Global ticket bonusesIf you buy the ticket for Pokémon Go Fest for $14.99, you’ll get the following:Special Research that allows you to catch VolcanionSpecial Research that allows you to power up Zacian or ZamazentaAccess to a global challenge that unlocks special bonuses every hourAccess to Collection ChallengesSpecial Incense encounters for Unown D, E, H, I, L, S, O, R, and W, as well as Incense encounters for Torkoal, Skiddo, Pachirisu, and KlefkiIncreased chance to find shiny PokémonThree surprise snapshot encounters per dayIncreased heart gains for buddy PokémonThe ability to open up to 40 gifts per dayThe ability to complete up to six special trades per dayHalved Stardust cost for tradingUp to nine free raid passes from spinning gym photo discsPokémon gated by real-money tickets usually do release for everyone, just later. If you’re not in a rush to get Volcanion or you don’t care for these other perks, you can always save your money and get the mythical Pokémon later.Outside of that glorious shiny buff, one of the bigger perks here is access to Torkoal, Pachirisu, and Klefki, three Pokémon that are usually regional exclusives.Pokémon Go Fest 2025 event Field ResearchSpinning a PokéStop during the event may yield one of these Field Research Tasks, with some of them being exclusive to certain days or habitats:Catch 8 different species of Pokémon (Pikachu [top hat] encounter)Catch 10 Pokémon (10 Poké Balls, 3 Ultra Balls, or 500 Stardust)Hatch an egg (1,000 Stardust)Spin 5 PokéStops or gyms (10 Poké Balls, 3 Ultra Balls, 500 Stardust)Win a raid (Falinks [train costume] encounter)Catch 6 steel-type Pokémon (3 Zamazenta Candy) — Saturday onlyPower up steel-type Pokémon 6 times (2 Zamazenta Candy XL or 500 Stardust) — Saturday onlyCatch 6 fairy-type Pokémon (3 Zacian Candy) — Sunday onlyPower up fairy-type Pokémon 6 times (2 Zacian Candy XL or 500 Stardust) — Sunday onlyCatch 6 fire-type Pokémon (Golett encounter) — Moonless Volcano onlyPower up fire-type Pokémon 6 times (Carbink encounter) — Moonless Volcano onlyCatch 6 fighting-type Pokémon (Pancham encounter) — Galvanic Dojo onlyPower up fighting-type Pokémon 6 times (Mienfoo encounter) — Galvanic Dojo onlyCatch 6 ice-type Pokémon (Bergmite encounter) — Hypnotic Tundra onlyPower up ice-type Pokémon 6 times (Frigibax encounter) — Hypnotic Tundra onlyCatch 6 poison-type Pokémon (Mawile encounter) — Fae Swamp onlyPower up poison-type Pokémon 6 times (Togetic encounter) — Fae Swamp onlyThe information above was compiled with help from Leek Duck.Pokémon Go Fest 2025 event special movesQuite a few legacy moves are returning as part of Go Fest 2025. Evolving these Pokémon will net them their Community Day or event moves:Alolan Sandshrew → Alolan Sandslash: Shadow ClawClefairy → Clefable: PoundMachoke → Machamp: Stone EdgePupitar → Tyranitar: Smack DownPrinplup → Empoleon: Hydro CannonQuilladin → Chesnaught: Frenzy PlantFletchinder → Talonflame: IncinerateBrionne → Primarina: Hydro CannonCrocalor → Skeledirge: Blast BurnIt also seems like caught Pokémon will also know these moves. We can confirm we had a Tyranitar spawn off of an Incense and it knew Smack Down.Pokémon Go Fest 2025 event egg hatchesEggs you get during the event may have a chance to hatch the following. Keep in mind that all players will have access to these 2 km eggs, but only ticket-holders will get these 5 km eggs:Karrablast (2 km)Shelmet (2 km)Golett (2 km)Pawniard (2 km)Vullaby (2 km)Pancham (2 km)Flabébé (blue/red/yellow/orange) (2 km)Oranguru (2 km)Passimian (2 km)Togepi (5 km)Torkoal (5 km)Pachirisu (5 km)Mienfoo (5 km)Skiddo (5 km)Carbink (5 km)Goomy (5 km)Klefki (5 km)Jangmo-o (5 km)Frigibax (5 km)All of the above Pokémon can be hatched shiny except Klefki.Pokémon Go Fest 2025 event raid targetsThe following Pokémon will be appearing in raids during the event:1-star raids3-star raids5-star raidsPikachu (top hat)Falinks (train costume)Crowned Shield Zamazenta (Saturday)FrigibaxCrowned Sword Zacian (Sunday)Did you finish that already? There’s still more to do for Pokémon Go Fest 2025.We also have tons of guides for everything Zacian and Zamazenta, including raid guides for the both of them, an explainer on how their Crowned forms work, and a list of free codes to score extra Crown Energy. We also have an explainer for the Zacian and Zamazenta Special Research and the Volcanion Special Research, which you’ll have if you bought the Go Fest 2025 ticket.
html:
Pokémon Go’s big yearly event is upon us. Pokémon Go Fest 2025 comes with its usual perks, including rotating spawns and the global debut of the Crowned forms of Zacian and Zamazenta.

The Crowned forms are the main feature here, encouraging all players to hop into raids to score energy to turn their Hero of Many Battles form puppies into big dogs. This event also features the global debut for Volcanion, but only if you have the paid ticket for the event. As usual with these events, there’s a ton of perks (including increased shiny rate for wild spawns) locked up behind the $15 ticket, but free players can still take advantage of fun spawns and Crowned Zacian and Zamazenta.

Below we dive into the perks and rotating spawns for Pokémon Go Fest: Global 2025.

Table of Contents

  • What time does Pokémon Go Fest start and end?
  • Pokémon Go Fest 2025 habitat spawn schedule
  • Pokémon Go Fest 2025: Global ticket bonuses
  • Pokémon Go Fest 2025 event Field Research
  • Pokémon Go Fest 2025 event special moves
  • Pokémon Go Fest 2025 event egg hatches
  • Pokémon Go Fest 2025 event raid targets

What time does Pokémon Go Fest start and end?

Pokémon Go Fest 2025 will run on June 28 and 29, starting at 10 a.m. and ending at 6 p.m. in your local time. There are a few ticket-holder bonuses that also last outside of that time window, like the halved Stardust cost for trading, but the bulk of the good stuff will only be available from 10 a.m. until 6 p.m.

Though you are highly encouraged to play throughout the day to make the most of your ticket purchase, and ensure you have plenty of time to complete each habitat’s Collection Challenges, even if you only log in once each day, you will unlock the Special Research to complete at your leisure.

Note that Zamazenta will be in raids on Saturday, June 28 and Zacian will be in raids on Sunday, June 29, so if you want both dogs, you’ll need to raid on both days.

Pokémon Go Fest 2025 habitat spawn schedule

Image: Niantic

These habitats will rotate all throughout the event (which is a change from last year, where they only rotated on Saturday), even if you don’t have a ticket. Each habitat will rotate in twice per day and be around for an hour before it rotates out.

This time, each day also has additional spawns that will be around in addition to the rotating habitats.

It should also be noted that the costume-wearing Pikachu and Falinks (as seen in the above image) are not listed as an available spawn on the Pokémon Go website. They are available through other means. Falinks appears to be a raid and Field Research exclusive and Pikachu can be obtained via raids, Field Research, and photobombs.

Moonless Volcano (10-11 a.m., 2-3 p.m.)

  • Houndour
  • Numel
  • Duskull
  • Gothita
  • Golett
  • Fletchling
  • Flabébé (red)
  • Skrelp
  • Fuecoco
  • Carbink
  • Torkoal (ticket-holder Incense only)

All of the above Pokémon can be found shiny.

Galvanic Dojo (11 a.m.-12 p.m, 3-4 p.m.)

  • Machop
  • Electabuzz
  • Teddirusa
  • Scraggy
  • Chespin
  • Flabébé (yellow)
  • Pancham
  • Dedenne
  • Crabrawler
  • Mienfoo
  • Skiddo (ticket-holder Incense only)

All of the above Pokémon can be found shiny.

Hypnotic Tundra (12-1 p.m., 4-5 p.m.)

  • Alolan Sandshrew
  • Swinub
  • Spheal
  • Piplup
  • Snover
  • Munna
  • Elgyem
  • Flabébé (blue)
  • Bergmite
  • Frigibax
  • Pachirisu (ticket-holder Incense only)

All of the above Pokémon can be found shiny.

Fae Swamp (1-2 p.m., 5-6 p.m.)

  • Clefairy
  • Tentacool
  • Mawile
  • Gulpin
  • Venipede
  • Popplio
  • Mareanie
  • Morelull
  • Togetic
  • Flabébé (orange)
  • Klefki (ticket-holder Incense only)

All of the above Pokémon can be found shiny, except Klefki.

Saturday all-day spawns

  • Chansey
  • Skarmory
  • Larvitar
  • Shieldon
  • Shelmet
  • Vullaby
  • Oranguru
  • Goomy

All of the above Pokémon can be found shiny.

Sunday all-day spawns

  • Galarian Farfetch’d
  • Cubone
  • Ralts
  • Karrablast
  • Pawniard
  • Deino
  • Passimian
  • Jangmo-o

All of the above Pokémon can be found shiny.

Pokémon Go Fest 2025: Global ticket bonuses

If you buy the ticket for Pokémon Go Fest for $14.99, you’ll get the following:

  • Special Research that allows you to catch Volcanion
  • Special Research that allows you to power up Zacian or Zamazenta
  • Access to a global challenge that unlocks special bonuses every hour
  • Access to Collection Challenges
  • Special Incense encounters for Unown D, E, H, I, L, S, O, R, and W, as well as Incense encounters for Torkoal, Skiddo, Pachirisu, and Klefki
  • Increased chance to find shiny Pokémon
  • Three surprise snapshot encounters per day
  • Increased heart gains for buddy Pokémon
  • The ability to open up to 40 gifts per day
  • The ability to complete up to six special trades per day
  • Halved Stardust cost for trading
  • Up to nine free raid passes from spinning gym photo discs

Pokémon gated by real-money tickets usually do release for everyone, just later. If you’re not in a rush to get Volcanion or you don’t care for these other perks, you can always save your money and get the mythical Pokémon later.

Outside of that glorious shiny buff, one of the bigger perks here is access to Torkoal, Pachirisu, and Klefki, three Pokémon that are usually regional exclusives.

Pokémon Go Fest 2025 event Field Research

Spinning a PokéStop during the event may yield one of these Field Research Tasks, with some of them being exclusive to certain days or habitats:

  • Catch 8 different species of Pokémon (Pikachu [top hat] encounter)
  • Catch 10 Pokémon (10 Poké Balls, 3 Ultra Balls, or 500 Stardust)
  • Hatch an egg (1,000 Stardust)
  • Spin 5 PokéStops or gyms (10 Poké Balls, 3 Ultra Balls, 500 Stardust)
  • Win a raid (Falinks [train costume] encounter)
  • Catch 6 steel-type Pokémon (3 Zamazenta Candy) — Saturday only
  • Power up steel-type Pokémon 6 times (2 Zamazenta Candy XL or 500 Stardust) — Saturday only
  • Catch 6 fairy-type Pokémon (3 Zacian Candy) — Sunday only
  • Power up fairy-type Pokémon 6 times (2 Zacian Candy XL or 500 Stardust) — Sunday only
  • Catch 6 fire-type Pokémon (Golett encounter) — Moonless Volcano only
  • Power up fire-type Pokémon 6 times (Carbink encounter) — Moonless Volcano only
  • Catch 6 fighting-type Pokémon (Pancham encounter) — Galvanic Dojo only
  • Power up fighting-type Pokémon 6 times (Mienfoo encounter) — Galvanic Dojo only
  • Catch 6 ice-type Pokémon (Bergmite encounter) — Hypnotic Tundra only
  • Power up ice-type Pokémon 6 times (Frigibax encounter) — Hypnotic Tundra only
  • Catch 6 poison-type Pokémon (Mawile encounter) — Fae Swamp only
  • Power up poison-type Pokémon 6 times (Togetic encounter) — Fae Swamp only

The information above was compiled with help from Leek Duck.

Pokémon Go Fest 2025 event special moves

Quite a few legacy moves are returning as part of Go Fest 2025. Evolving these Pokémon will net them their Community Day or event moves:

  • Alolan Sandshrew → Alolan Sandslash: Shadow Claw
  • Clefairy → Clefable: Pound
  • Machoke → Machamp: Stone Edge
  • Pupitar → Tyranitar: Smack Down
  • Prinplup → Empoleon: Hydro Cannon
  • Quilladin → Chesnaught: Frenzy Plant
  • Fletchinder → Talonflame: Incinerate
  • Brionne → Primarina: Hydro Cannon
  • Crocalor → Skeledirge: Blast Burn

It also seems like caught Pokémon will also know these moves. We can confirm we had a Tyranitar spawn off of an Incense and it knew Smack Down.

Pokémon Go Fest 2025 event egg hatches

Eggs you get during the event may have a chance to hatch the following. Keep in mind that all players will have access to these 2 km eggs, but only ticket-holders will get these 5 km eggs:

  • Karrablast (2 km)
  • Shelmet (2 km)
  • Golett (2 km)
  • Pawniard (2 km)
  • Vullaby (2 km)
  • Pancham (2 km)
  • Flabébé (blue/red/yellow/orange) (2 km)
  • Oranguru (2 km)
  • Passimian (2 km)
  • Togepi (5 km)
  • Torkoal (5 km)
  • Pachirisu (5 km)
  • Mienfoo (5 km)
  • Skiddo (5 km)
  • Carbink (5 km)
  • Goomy (5 km)
  • Klefki (5 km)
  • Jangmo-o (5 km)
  • Frigibax (5 km)

All of the above Pokémon can be hatched shiny except Klefki.

Pokémon Go Fest 2025 event raid targets

The following Pokémon will be appearing in raids during the event:

1-star raids

3-star raids

5-star raids

Pikachu (top hat)Falinks (train costume)Crowned Shield Zamazenta (Saturday)
FrigibaxCrowned Sword Zacian (Sunday)

Did you finish that already? There’s still more to do for Pokémon Go Fest 2025.

We also have tons of guides for everything Zacian and Zamazenta, including raid guides for the both of them, an explainer on how their Crowned forms work, and a list of free codes to score extra Crown Energy. We also have an explainer for the Zacian and Zamazenta Special Research and the Volcanion Special Research, which you’ll have if you bought the Go Fest 2025 ticket.
